titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Richard Apperson papers, approximately 1800
titlestmt.author: Processed by: Rubenstein Staff; EAD finding aid derived from MARC record using marc2ead_sectionA.xsl

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid derived from MARC record via marc2ead_sectionA.xsl, 2017

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University

did.abstract: Two items referring to a duel between Apperson and a Dr. Holmes, located in Petersburg, Virginia. One is a draft for a handbill denouncing Dr. Holmes, and the other a letter about the printed handbills and other matters connected to the dispute. Items are undated but appear to be from approximately 1800.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

prefercite.p: Richard Apperson Papers, approximately 1800, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

processinfo.p: This finding aid was derived from a MARC record using a crosswalk defined in marc2ead_section.xsl. The finding aid was generated as part of a larger project to digitize several thousand small collections housed in Section A, January 2017.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: A Revolutionary War soldier from the Continental line, who served under George Rogers Clark in the Northwest.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: Two items referring to a duel between Apperson and a Dr. Holmes, located in Petersburg, Virginia. One is a draft for a handbill denouncing Dr. Holmes, and the other a letter about the printed handbills and other matters connected to the dispute. Items are undated but appear to be from approximately 1800.
